title: Set uploaded cruise photo as homepage hero image

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image "cruise-290913_1280.jpg" to the deployed frontend static assets as the homepage hero image file at the exact public path "/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg" (1600x900).

quotes: this is the picture to put on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: A file exists in the built/deployed frontend at frontend/public/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg.
The image is 1600x900 and loads successfully at /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg in the browser (no 404).

requirements.text: Ensure the homepage hero section uses the hero image from "/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg" and displays it as a full-screen background with a sensible cover/fill behavior across common viewport sizes.

quotes: this is the picture to put on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: On the homepage, the hero background renders the cruise photo and covers the hero area without distortion (object-fit: cover behavior).
The hero image continues to fade in when it loads, and the existing gradient overlay keeps the headline readable on top of the photo.

requirements.text: Keep (or add if missing) the current resilient fallback behavior for the homepage hero: if the hero image fails to load, the gradient background remains visible and a small readable error message is shown without breaking layout.

quotes: this is the picture to put on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: If the hero image URL is invalid or the file is missing, the page still renders the hero with the gradient background and a readable error message.
No layout shifting or blank/white hero section occurs when the image fails to load.

requirements.text: Ensure the HTML preload link (if present) matches the hero image path exactly so the browser preloads the correct asset: "/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg".

quotes: this is the picture to put on the front page

acceptanceCriteria: After deployment, network waterfall shows the correct hero image preloading (or at minimum no preload 404).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx.
nonGoals: Changing backend data models or adding backend endpoints for serving the hero image.
Adding user-configurable hero image management in the admin dashboard.

edits: Crop/resize the uploaded photo to a wide hero format (cruise-290913_1280.jpg > cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg)
